pdu.name: bind_transmitter
pdu.doc: Authentication PDU used by a transmitter ESME to bind to the Message Centre. The PDU contains identification information and an access password for the ESME.

pdu.name: bind_transmitter_resp
pdu.doc: Message Centre response to a bind_transmitter PDU. This PDU indicates the success or failure of the ESME's attempt to bind as a transmitter

pdu.name: bind_receiver
pdu.doc: Authentication PDU used by a receiver ESME to bind to the Message Centre. The PDU contains identification information, an access password for the ESME and may also contain routing information specifying the range of addresses serviced by the ESME.

pdu.name: bind_receiver_resp
pdu.doc: Message Centre response to a bind_receiver PDU. This PDU indicates the success or failure of the ESME's attempt to bind as a receiver

pdu.name: bind_transceiver
pdu.doc: Authentication PDU used by a transceiver ESME to bind to the Message Centre. The PDU contains identification information, an access password for the ESME and may also contain routing information specifying the range of addresses serviced by the ESME.

pdu.name: bind_transceiver_resp
pdu.doc: Message Centre response to a bind_transceiver PDU. This PDU indicates the success or failure of the ESME's attempt to bind as a transceiver

pdu.name: outbind
pdu.doc: Authentication PDU used by a Message Centre to Outbind to an ESME to inform it that messages are present in the MC. The PDU contains identification, and access password for the ESME. If the ESME authenticates the request, it will respond with a bind_receiver or bind_transceiver to begin the process of binding into the MC.

pdu.name: unbind
pdu.doc: This PDU can be sent by the ESME or MC as a means of initiating the termination of a SMPP session.

pdu.name: unbind_resp
pdu.doc: This PDU can be sent by the ESME or MC as a means of acknowledging the receipt of an unbind request. After sending this PDU the MC typically closes the network connection.

pdu.name: enquire_link
pdu.doc: This PDU can be sent by the ESME or MC to test the network connection. The receiving peer is expected to acknowledge the PDU as a means of verifying the test.

pdu.name: enquire_link_resp
pdu.doc: This PDU is used to acknowledge an enquire_link request sent by an ESME or MC.

pdu.name: alert_notification
pdu.doc: ToBeDocumented

pdu.name: generic_nack
pdu.doc: A MC sends an alert_notification to an ESME as a means of altering it to the availability of an SME.

pdu.name: submit_sm
pdu.mandatory: service_type source_addr dest_addr esm_class protocol_id priority_flag schedule_delivery_time validity_period registered_delivery replace_if_present_flag data_coding sm_default_msg_id short_message
pdu.optional: alert_on_msg_delivery billing_identification callback_num callback_num_atag callback_num_pres_ind dest_addr_subunit dest_bearer_type dest_network_type dest_subaddress dest_telematics_id destination_port display_time its_reply_type its_session_info language_indicator message_payload more_messages_to_send ms_msg_wait_facilities ms_validity number_of_messages payload_type privacy_indicator qos_time_to_live sar_msg_ref_num sar_segment_seqnum sar_total_segments set_dpf sms_signal source_addr_subunit source_bearer_type source_network_type source_port source_subaddress source_telematics_id user_message_reference user_response_code ussd_service_op
pdu.doc: A transmitter or transceiver ESME, wishing to submit a short message, can use this PDU to specify the sender, receiver text of the short message. Other attributes include message priority, data coding scheme, validity period etc.

pdu.name: submit_sm_resp
pdu.doc: The MC response to a submit_sm PDU, indicating the success or failure of the request. Also included is a MC message_id can be used in subsequent operations to query, cancel or replace the contents of an undelivered message.

pdu.name: data_sm
pdu.mandatory: service_type source_addr dest_addr esm_class registered_delivery data_coding
pdu.optional: alert_on_msg_delivery billing_identification callback_num callback_num_atag callback_num_pres_ind dest_addr_subunit dest_bearer_type dest_network_type dest_subaddress dest_telematics_id destination_port display_time its_reply_type its_session_info language_indicator message_payload more_messages_to_send ms_msg_wait_facilities ms_validity number_of_messages payload_type privacy_indicator qos_time_to_live sar_msg_ref_num sar_segment_seqnum sar_total_segments set_dpf sms_signal source_addr_subunit source_bearer_type source_network_type source_port source_subaddress source_telematics_id user_message_reference user_response_code ussd_service_op
pdu.doc: Data_sm is a streamlined version of the submit_sm operation, designed for packet-based applications that do not demand extended functionality normally available in the submit_sm operation. ESMEs implementing WAP over SMS typically use this operation.

pdu.name: data_sm_resp
pdu.doc: The MC response to a data_sm PDU, indicating the success failure of the request. Also included is a MC message_id that can be used in subsequent operations to query, cancel or replace the contents of an undelivered message.

pdu.name: submit_multi
pdu.mandatory: service_type source_addr dest_addresses esm_class protocol_id priority_flag schedule_delivery_time validity_period registered_delivery replace_if_present_flag data_coding sm_default_msg_id short_message
pdu.optional: alert_on_msg_delivery billing_identification callback_num callback_num_atag callback_num_pres_ind dest_addr_subunit dest_bearer_type dest_network_type dest_subaddress dest_telematics_id destination_port display_time its_reply_type its_session_info language_indicator message_payload more_messages_to_send ms_msg_wait_facilities ms_validity number_of_messages payload_type privacy_indicator qos_time_to_live sar_msg_ref_num sar_segment_seqnum sar_total_segments set_dpf sms_signal source_addr_subunit source_bearer_type source_network_type source_port source_subaddress source_telematics_id user_message_reference user_response_code ussd_service_op
pdu.doc: A variation of the submit_sm PDU that included support for 255 recipients for the given message.

pdu.name: submit_multi_resp
pdu.doc: The MC response to a submit_multi PDU. This is similar to submit_sm_resp PDU. The main difference is that where some of the specified recipients were either invalid or rejected by Message Centre, the PDU can specify the list of failed recipients, appending a specific error code for each one, indicating the reason the recipient was invalid. Also included MC message_id that can be used in subsequent operations query, cancel or replace the contents of an undelivered message.

pdu.name: deliver_sm
pdu.mandatory: service_type source_addr dest_addr esm_class protocol_id priority_flag schedule_delivery_time validity_period registered_delivery replace_if_present_flag data_coding sm_default_msg_id short_message
pdu.optional: callback_num callback_num_atag callback_num_pres_ind dest_addr_subunit dest_subaddress destination_port dpf_result its_reply_type its_session_info language_indicator message_payload message_state network_error_code payload_type privacy_indicator receipted_message_id sar_msg_ref_num sar_segment_seqnum sar_total_segments source_addr_subunit source_port source_subaddress user_message_reference user_response_code ussd_service_op
pdu.doc: Deliver_sm is the symmetric opposite to submit_sm and is used by a MC to deliver a message to a receiver or transceiver ESME.

pdu.name: deliver_sm_resp
pdu.doc: This PDU indicates the ESMEs acceptance or rejection of the delivered message. The error returned by the ESME can cause the message to be retried at a later date or rejected there and then.

pdu.name: broadcast_sm
pdu.mandatory: service_type source_addr message_id priority_flag schedule_delivery_time validity_period replace_if_present_flag data_coding sm_default_msg_id
pdu.optional: broadcast_area_identifier broadcast_category_specific_info broadcast_content_type number_of_broadcasts broadcast_frequency_interval user_message_reference source_port source_addr_subunit destination_port dest_addr_subunit payload_type message_payload privacy_indicator callback_num callback_num_pres_ind callback_num_atag source_subaddress dest_subaddress display_time sms_signal ms_validity alert_on_msg_delivery language_indicator broadcast_message_class broadcast_channel_indicator broadcast_service_group
pdu.doc: A broadcast ESME, wishing to broadcast a short message, can use this PDU to specify the alias, geographical areas, and text of the short message.

pdu.name: broadcast_sm_resp
pdu.doc: The MC response to a broadcast_sm PDU, indicating the success or failure of the request. Also included is a MC message_id that can be used in subsequent operations to query or cancel the message.

pdu.name: cancel_sm
pdu.doc: This PDU is used to cancel a previously submitted message. The PDU contains the source address of the original message and the message_id returned in the original submit_sm_resp, submit_multi_resp or data_sm_resp PDU. This PDU may also omit the message_id and instead contain a source address, destination address and optional service_type field as a means of cancelling a range of messages sent from one address to another.

pdu.name: cancel_sm_resp
pdu.doc: The MC returns this PDU to indicate the success or failure of a cancel_sm PDU.

pdu.name: query_sm
pdu.doc: This PDU is used to query the state of a previously submitted message. The PDU contains the source address of the original message and the message_id returned in the original submit_sm_resp, submit_multi_resp or data_sm_resp PDU.

pdu.name: query_sm_resp
pdu.doc: The MC returns a query_sm_resp PDU as a means of indicating the result of a message query attempt. The PDU will indicate the success or failure of the attempt and for successful attempts will also include the current state of the message.

pdu.name: replace_sm
pdu.mandatory: message_id source_addr schedule_delivery_time validity_period registered_delivery sm_default_msg_id short_message
pdu.doc: The replace_sm PDU is used by an ESME to pass a message_id of a previously submitted message along with several other fields used to update the text, validity period and other attributes of the message.

pdu.name: replace_sm_resp
pdu.doc: The replace_sm_resp PDU indicates the success or failure of a replace_sm PDU.

pdu.name: cancel_broadcast_sm
pdu.doc: This PDU is used to cancel the state of a previously broadcast message.

pdu.name: cancel_broadcast_sm_resp
pdu.doc: Response to cancel_broadcast_sm PDU.

pdu.name: query_broadcast_sm
pdu.doc: This PDU is used to query the state of a previously broadcast message. The PDU contains the source address of the original message and the message_id returned in the original broadcast_sm_resp PDU.

pdu.name: query_broadcast_sm_resp
pdu.doc: The MC returns a query_broadcast_sm_resp PDU as a means of indicating the result of a broadcast query attempt. The PDU will indicate the success or failure of the attempt and for successful attempts will also include the current state of the message.

param.name: dest_addr
param.doc: Specifies the destination SME address. For mobile terminated messages, this is the directory number of the recipient MS.

param.name: esme_addr
param.doc: Specifies the address of an ESME address to which an alert_notification should be routed.

param.name: esm_class
param.doc: The esm_class parameter is used to indicate special message attributes associated with the short message.

param.name: interface_version
param.doc: This parameter is used to indicate the version of the SMPP protocol.

param.name: message_id
param.doc: The unique message identifier reference assigned by the MC to each submitted short message. It is an opaque value and is set according to MC implementation.

param.name: message_state
param.doc: The message_state value is returned by the MC to the ESME as part of the query_sm_resp PDU.
